title: Keramas Beach
text: At first glance, a very atmospheric place: spacious, long sandy spit, black volcanic sand. But if you look closely, you will see the following: piles of garbage and dead dogs, large waves that don't allow swimming, small trays with incomprehensible goods for incomprehensible buyers, because the beach is deserted. Absolutely nothing but garbage and hopelessness.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Peaceful, authentic place without mass tourism :)

title: Keramas Beach
text: Nothing much to see. The sand is black like coal that has been crushed. It was burdensome to walk on it. In April in Bali, it seems to be the season of bugs. There are too many bugs. The Keramas Beach area is overflowing with bugs.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Beautiful, calm, and peaceful black sand beach in the Gianyar area. Came in the late afternoon on a weekend and was surprised it was fairly empty, except for a few other tourists and fishermen. The black sand really heats up during the day, so best to keep your sandals and slippers on until you get to the slightly damper part of the beach.

title: Keramas Beach
text: One of the best long Black sand beaches with strong waves (check Tide Table & weather apps before you visit) Recommended for a morning visit, easy to reach via Gojek, but to leave with Gojek, you need to avoid local taxi mafia by leaving till the main road junction, beyond the paddy field (not ideal for sunset / night travel) The beach is clean, if not overlapping with weekends or festival crowds, so no complaints if you visit during non-peak season morning with no crowd. Not recommended for swimming alone as there is no safe guard, you are dealing with Pacific Ocean waves and undercurrent.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Beautiful beach! We combined the beach/surf day with a visit to the Komune hotel. We also rented a surfboard there (100K/hour). Swimming was not recommended due to the coral and possible injuries. But the hotel has a swimming pool, so that compensates. You have to spend at least 300K to sit on the poolside sun loungers. Don't want to? Then you can also sit comfortably at a table in the restaurant.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Particular beach with black sand and where you can surf

title: Keramas Beach
text: Beautiful black sand beach. Walk a bit south from the pin on Google maps, for about 10-15 minutes, and the beach will be mostly empty! Be careful when swimming, the waves hit hard on this beach! 4 stars because there's a lot of trash scattered about.

title: Keramas Beach
text: It was exciting to experience black volcanic sand on the beach. The beach is cleaner near the cafes and hotels; otherwise, there is a lot of trash. We found a really nice place to be, so we enjoyed ourselves for a few hours. Almost all beaches in Bali are similarly dirty, unfortunately. Be aware that you cannot swim there, the waves are very large and powerful. Children cannot be near the water without adults beside them, the currents are too strong. Otherwise, it was a nice experience on the black sand beach next to the sea and palms.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Black sand beach with surfers only. Not crowded at all. There are some warnings in some spots along the coast not to swim because of strong currents. However, there are nice surfer bars/cafes like in Balangan beach and even some beach clubs with a pool.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Dirty beach and strong waves :(

title: Keramas Beach

title: Keramas Beach
text: Depends on when you come here. During high tide, the beach is clean and quite interesting with its glittering black sand. Cool to watch the surfers. The small bars and the more expensive bar by the Komune Hotel are great places to hang out and watch the waves. However, during low tide, it is full of garbage. It is slightly sad.

title: Keramas Beach
text: A lovely deserted beach, but mountains of trash. Locals don't care about the garbage, the main thing is paying in restaurants.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Plastic everywhere, not suitable for anything other than a quick walk to say you've seen the black sand. Let's all help Bali together by picking up our trash.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Follow the direction from Google Maps, and you will encounter a narrow road on the left side that leads to a quite wide area for parking. The beach does not have many locals, so it is relatively free from vendors. Free entry. Apparently, many people surf here. It is also one of the beaches in Bali with black sands.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Blissful view ??

title: Keramas Beach
text: I don't really like this beach. I've been here several times and have seen a lot of garbage in the sea, plastic bags, and other waste. The beach is deserted, mainly surfers??? hang out. There are a couple of small beach clubs and warungs. Not far from the beach, there is a brewery with astronomically expensive beer and a small winery.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Beautiful black sand beach! There weren’t a lot of people when we were there at 2 pm. While we saw a warung/restaurant there, there are no vendors along the beach, so it’s indeed a peaceful place. There’s quite a bit of rubbish at their beach though, as with most public beaches in Bali.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Gorgeous beach for walking and maybe for surfing ???

title: Keramas Beach
text: Very unusual and beautiful beach.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Lovely quiet black sand beach, not heavily exploited, with shiny volcanic sand. A large amount of garbage comes from the small river that flows into the beach and from the sea. We saw some employees cleaning certain parts of the beach (only those that coincided with the resorts and restaurant). When the tide is low, it's more pleasant for bathing, although you'll be surrounded by plastics floating in the water. With the tide high, complicated. Much current and high waves. A good option for surfers??? By the way, if you plan to go there with Grab, be careful about the return if you are staying in Ubud or far from the beach. They take you there, but then no cars arrive at the beach for the return. We tried, and no driver accepted the trip. Finally, we returned to Ubud with a taxi (it will be marked on the way to the beach).

title: Keramas Beach
text: Beautiful but dirty

title: Keramas Beach
text: Amazing beach, not much around the beach, so make sure to pack some good and drinks, and have a reliable mode of transport, since this beach is away from all the tourists spots. The beach is super dirty, with lots of plastic trash, so not ideal for children to play sand. Waves are pretty high and aggressive, not for swimming either, not sure about surfing. Nice for a morning walk along the beach catching the sunrise.

title: Keramas Beach
text: The beach with lava sand is beautiful, but you cannot swim there due to rolling waves. Some religious celebrations happened during my stay on that beach, with musicians and local usages. I liked to observe with respect #nopicture #novideo

title: Keramas Beach
text: Super relaxing black-sand beach off the beaten trail (ish). We came here at sunset the other day and had a nice little swim and then laid out on the sand for a bit afterward. It’s quiet and not too crowded—very different from most other beaches.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Very pretty black sand beach with lots of palm trees around. There were very few people when we visited, which adds to its charm! On the downside, the sea is usually very agitated, with strong waves that prevent bathing. It's also a shame that there was a lot of waste on the sand.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Volcanic sand! Very beautiful. You can swim but carefully, big waves.

With a view of Agung. And the beach itself... magic

Like most beaches in Indonesia, there's a lot of rubbish everywhere; hopefully, the area could be better taken care of. Easy parking.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Nice, not crowded place, but there were bonfires with garbage and a terrible smell.

title: Keramas Beach
text: I liked the beach with black sand, as it was new to me. Onshore, there are restaurants and relaxation areas. There are big waves here. It's nice for surfers, but I wouldn't risk swimming.

title: Keramas Beach
text: We decided to try this beach for the first time; it was a bit difficult to get there from Ubud, and you have to backtrack on the bypass to find the turnoff. The black sand beach is really interesting in texture. The beach is very quiet compared to other areas, and hopefully, it won't turn into a negative touristy spot. This beach is certainly not a place for swimming; it is a surfing beach and is way too dangerous for swimming. It is nice for walking and taking photos; it's pretty good for watching the little crabs scurrying about.

title: Keramas Beach
text: The beach with the finest black sand that we found on the east coast. It was really quiet, the waves are quite big, making it difficult to swim. However, we had an "encounter" with some geese, a really great image.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Just a black sand beach. Nice cafe and restaurant nearby.

text: It would be nice if sewage didn't go straight into the ocean few meters away.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Great surfing beach with big waves breaking on a reef. I have not seen anyone brave enough to swim here. Beautiful black volcanic sand with sparkly mica that shines in the sunlight.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Nice beach wih black sand. Wave in here really can make you calm.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Beautiful black sand beach created by millions of years of volcanic eruptions mixed with erosion from the ocean. The best right wave on the island of Bali that is known to host professional surfers( Kelly Slater). This wave can be heavy and unforgiving so not the best place to learn to surf. Experienced surfers only .

title: Keramas Beach
text: Comfortable, clean, good overall

title: Keramas Beach
text: Good place for relax, no much people come, dont have a toilet (rest room) so many villa. Good for photoshoot dan make a video

title: Keramas Beach
text: One of most beautiful natural looking black sand beach in gianyar, nice spot for surfing with it’s big waves. Some restaurants available along this beach. On ceremony & rainy season it can be very dirty  note : come in the morning, it’s really nice & quiet  and no entrance fee

title: Keramas Beach
text: Incredibile world class surfing spot working every single day, beautiful nature, stunning view from the water. Very chill

title: Keramas Beach
text: Not a good beach for swimming, great for lazing by the ocean. It's not advisable to swim at all due to strong underwater currents, but there are some of our crazy compatriots who still splash around in the water, ignoring the numerous warning signs. There are no lifeguards on the beach

title: Keramas Beach
text: Beautiful beach, magical sand

title: Keramas Beach
text: Beautiful and secluded beach! Perfect for surfing. The black sand adds to the atmosphere. Advice: do not put any electronics on the sand or rocks. It will be difficult to clean them later. There is a cafe with swans near the beach. Beautiful, atmospheric, but a bit pricey.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Interesting beach with black sand. Unfortunately, there were big waves today, so it was not possible to swim as there was a risk to life. There were hardly any people; the beach is clean. We will come again and might give a higher rating.

title: Keramas Beach
text: Beautiful beach

title: Place for surfing
text: This is a prime area for surfers. The beach was rather littered with debris and rubbish during our visit. This is a black sand beach and very popular with surfers and surfing contests. There is a choice of accommodation in all budgets within a stroll of the beach. Great for a few days of relaxing and getting away from the crowds and good choice for surfers

title: Scored some Keramas tubes
text: Took my 16 year old out here early the other morning for the famous wave and we were lucky to score it on a good day. Punchy 3 foot tube ride and about 15 others out there ripping it. Definite must for the surfers out there. Black sand beach glittered in the sun.

title: QUIET, CALM SERENE - in the shoulder season
text: Keramas Beach was recommended by friends... during the shoulder season, it was a laid-back, serene, clean beach.  There is an ‘international cuisine’ restaurant, and villas right on the beach-front. In the late afternoon, there were a few folks fishing, and children playing on the beach. Very relaxing !

title: It's ok! Nothing special
text:
Vast black sand beach 20mins NE of Sanur popular for surfing although there were only one or two boards out when I was there. Not sure about swimming as there were no signs up or flags on safe parts of the beach to swim. I would say not for children or non confident swimmers. You can see more of the coast and across to Nusa Penida. 
There is not much going on, minimal facilities.. accommodation, places to eat etc.

title: International surf competition!
text: One wave from the best surfeurs in the world! Thank you Keramas & Corona Bali Protected! Thank you Kanoa Igarashi for the dreamy show! Thank you Kelly Slater & Stephanie Gilmore for the surf lesson just watching you!

title: My favorite beach on Bali
text: I will admit that I had given up on Bali's beaches (excluding the smaller islands) but on my last day I was able to visit Keramas and very happy I did. The black sand was beautiful that day, and the strong sun helped it gleam and shine against the blue water, making it a very dramatic sight. A handful of little cafes (excellently priced) and nice resorts make it an easy beach to go to for any budget. Would love to stay on the beach next time.

title: Surf paradise
text:
watch so many young man surf in this beach is make me fell want to learn how to surf , with good wafe

when I was enjoy my self watch the waves rooling down to the beach make me realize why the like to surf in this beach, big waves & not too crowd thats why they comr here to surf.

.

title: Looking for surf place
text: Less tourist, good spot for surf. I heart this places has nice wave for people doing surf, specially at night house they have big light.

title: worth the visit
text: amazing to see jet black natural volcanic beach. great surf beach but also great to explore with the many natural objects that are washed up from the ocean floor.

title: Black is the new white
text:
Do you like white sandy beaches? Have you visit a black sand beach?
Black sand shimmers in a way white can't. It's beautiful and magical. 

But this is not a beach to lay and relax. It's very empty and have just a few places to eat and no chairs. Also black sand does stick everywhere. :-)

But if you want a bit alone time on a beach, this is perfect.

title: really awesome
text: great for surfing, black sand beaches! really awesome place if youre a surfer... its world famous! we dont surf but enjoyed the area around and took cars to get to other restaurants nearby!

title: Volcanic beach great for surfing
text: Lovely beach with high waves, sand was too dark and the view was spectacular. It isnt safe to swim due to the high waves though.

title: Amazing black sparkly sand
text: You need to see the black sparkly sand on this beach to believe how amazing it is. The beach isnt the best for swimming, but great for surfing. Good for wetting your legs or a quick dip at high tide. A beautiful outlook and place to watch the surfers from the Komune Resort.

title: Wild water, good for surfers, not for swinmming
text: We lived in the Diamond Villas at Keramas Beach. Unfortunately we are not surfer and weren't aware that the beach is not good for swimming so we couldn't use it. We walked some tours and dined at Timor Kitchen (very recommendable) and the Swan Restaurant (nice place). The beach is ok clean and if you like big waves it is nice to sit and look over the wild ocean.

title: Black sand beach
text: This is a black sand beach with great sunset views and good surf. The beach is not so clean but still nice for a relaxing walk.

title: Amazing Beach with black sparkling sand and incredible sunset!
text: An Amazing Beach with black sparkling sand that shines like glitter and incredible sunsets every day! Great surf spot or place to relax!

title: Could be beautiful.
text: This beach is could be so beautiful, but there is so much litter everywhere it's a real shame. It's worth the visit regardless.

title: Good for Surfing
text: good for surfing, otherwise not very pretty beach, dark sand. But you can enjoy at the resort infant of the beach

title: Worth a visit
text:
For visitors such as myself coming from Australia, I am used to white sandy beaches. Keramas does not have that. It has black sand, which is due to the volcanoes of Bali and the black sand shimmers in the sunlight.

The beach itself would be picture perfect if were were not for rubbish left strewn around, which certainly lessens its beauty. However, the rubbish is less than is regularly sighted on Kuta Beach.

Keramas Beach is only 45  minutes drive from Kuta and is worth the visit for a walk along the black sand or to catch to some good sized waves.

title: Walking in the beach with black sands
text: This beach with black sands collection. You can play surfing here of playing with sands. Around this beach, many restaurant and hotel.

title: For surf
text: This is a great beach for surf. Have good waves but the water is not so clean and have a lot of trash. Just surf not swim....

title: Take a long walk on this Keramas black sand!
text:
You will not be able to swim on this beach, but you will definitely love a long beach walk on this black sand while enjoying the warm water of Indian Ocean. 
There is a wooden bar at the entrance from the road, where you can enjoy your Coconut with only 15 000,00 idr while listening to the ocean. 
The place is not crowded at all, so if you need a momentous of quietness this is a place for you!

title: Keramas beach

title: Best for surfing
text: pretty good distance from us. but it paid off with a very beautiful waves for surfing, you better go with the local guide drivers gede +62 878-6136-8555

title: Great for surfers, otherwise very dirty
text: The beach itself is lovely - black volcano sand that sparkles on the sand, great waves and few nice spots to have a drink. Apart from that, unless you're staying at Komuna Resort & Beach Club (which has a small pool with some sunbeds around), you wouldn't want to put your towel on the beach itself. It's literally covered in garbage..

title: Bali's must visit place
text: Wonderful spot. In a shiny day the black volcanic sand looks like filled with diamond powder. It shines. Huge waves and lotta surfers.

title: a nice empty beach
text: i loved this beach because there was almost no one! and more important my boyfriend had a really good surf!

title: Keramas beach is that exotic beauty with dark kohl eyes and long shimmery jet black hair
text:
If u are seeking a slightly different experience from white sandy beaches, mojitos and beach club pounding loud house music, u may want to explore the keramas black beach
I was looking for something different from a the perfectly manicured gardens and palm trees swaying and keramas beach situated on the south eastern side of Bali is a delightful gem.

There's something introspective and mystical about the black beach that can only be experienced if u do a lone  beach walk,  listening to the symphony of the Indian Ocean and let your imagination reach  the far depths of the oceans trenches. You watch unrelenting waves satisfying the adrenalin  of  surfers, you observe the foamy sea water caressing every black stone that is a little piece of art from the stone carver call the Ocean. You can also spot locals flying kites, Balinese ladies  offering canang to the spirits of the seas, and a smattering of vacationers on the beautiful  beach front villas. 

Komune beach club  is a must visit, they have beautiful Nasi goreng and a good piña colada. 
Do nothing except to breath, soak up the delicious saltiness of the ocean breeze, and catch the sunrise emerging from the distant mount Agung every morning 
If the white sandy beach is that sexy perfectly tanned blond babe,Then the black beach of keramas must surely be that exotic beauty with dark kohl eyes and shimmery black hair

title: Hot sand...
text: This is a great to surf when the wind is blowing onshore on Uluwatu. There is a beck break with lots of fun peaks and a reef brake in front of the Komune hotel. Great surf! just be sure to bring sandals ... the sand is really hot

title: Black sandy beach - amazing to see
text: What's all the secretness about where the black sandy beaches in Bali are?  There are kilometres and kilometres of them.  Many are very easy to reach and one is Keramas beach about half an hours taxi drive from Kuta.  My wife and I will come back and stay at the nearest resort/hotel next time.  This is a wonderful Balinese beach to visit and see black sand.  It has its own beauty.
